meanings.definition: Twist together (strands of thread, rope, etc.) to form twine.
meanings.sent1: She twines the colorful threads to make a friendship bracelet.
meanings.sent2: He twines the vines around the trellis for support.
meanings.sent3: The cat twines itself around my legs, seeking attention.
meanings.sent4: The ivy twines up the old brick wall, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's ribbons twine gracefully as she moves across the stage.

meanings.definition: A strong thread or string composed of two or more strands twisted together.
meanings.sent1: She used twines to tie the package securely.
meanings.sent2: The twines held the tent poles in place during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled endless twines from his sleeve during the show.
meanings.sent4: The spider silk was as delicate as the finest twines.
meanings.sent5: The twines of the hammock swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To wind or twist together; interlace.
meanings.sent1: The branches twines together to form a natural archway.
meanings.sent2: She twines her fingers through his as they walk along the beach.
meanings.sent3: The yarn twines itself into a tangled mess if not handled carefully.
meanings.sent4: The stories of the past and present twine together to create our history.
meanings.sent5: The river twines through the valley, reflecting the sunlight.
